logs.name: FirstUser
logs.text: well thats a no brainer hillary clinton gave huma abdein a security clearance when she has ties to a known terrorist group the muslim brotherhood, and her mother runs an anti american news paper in the middle east, debbie washed up crook shultz got the awan famaily security clearances and they were recent immigrants, had absolutely no IT experience and possible ties to terrorist groups in pakistan. its pretty clear our liberal ran government is a complete and total failure when it comes to national security. 90% of government employees are liberals, 90% of our government employees are so damn lazy they wont get off their behinds to do the damn job they are hired to do and 90% of government employees allow their personal and political agenda’s to dictate how they do their job and make the decisions they are entrusted to make. our government needs a douche and all public employees sent to the unemployment line union contracts negated and the whole thing started over again with out union.

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: Oh, please. @FirstUser, you're just parroting Fox News talking points. Hillary Clinton didn't give Huma Abedin a security clearance, the State Department did. And your anti-American newspaper claim is just a right-wing conspiracy theory. As for the Awans, the whole thing was a nothingburger. But hey, keep blaming liberals for everything, it's easier than thinking critically, isn't it? 🙄

logs.name: TechGuru88
logs.text: Well, @QueenOfChaos, you're right that Hillary didn't personally give Huma the clearance, but she was the one who hired her. And the 'anti-American newspaper' claim isn't just a conspiracy theory - Huma's mother is a known supporter of the Muslim Brotherhood. As for the Awans, the fact that they had access to sensitive data for years without proper vetting is a massive security risk. But hey, keep defending the indefensible, it's easier than admitting that both sides have their issues, isn't it? 😒

logs.name: WiseOwl71
QueenOfChaos
logs.text: Oh, here we go with the both sides nonsense. @W

logs.name: WiseOwl71
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, I'm not here to play the both sides game, but to point out that neither side is blameless. If we want to improve our system, we need to acknowledge the problems on both ends. Dismissing one side's concerns just because you disagree with their politics isn't productive. Let's focus on the facts and work towards solutions, not just score political points.

logs.name: TechGuru88
logs.text: @WiseOwl71, you're right that both sides have had issues, but let's not pretend that the scale is balanced. The current admin has had its share of controversies, sure, but the sheer number of security clearance scandals under the previous admin is staggering. And yes, we should fix the system, but that starts with acknowledging the root causes, not just sweeping it under the rug with a 'both sides' argument. As for @QueenOfChaos, dismissing concerns because they're politically inconvenient isn't productive either. Let's not forget, Huma's mother's ties were a valid concern, regardless of who brought it up. Let's have a real discussion about how to fix the system, not just a political blame game. 😒

logs.name: doing_my_best24
logs.text: @WiseOwl71, you're absolutely right. The 'both sides' argument can sometimes feel like a cop-out, but it's important to acknowledge that no political party is perfect. However, @QueenOfChaos, you can't just dismiss concerns because they come from a source you don't agree with. That's how we end up with echo chambers and missed opportunities for real change. And @TechGuru88, while the previous admin did have its share of scandals, let's not forget that the current admin has also had issues. The point is, we need to address the systemic problems, not just point fingers. Let's focus on solutions, not political point-scoring.

logs.name: QueenOfChaos
logs.text: Oh, please. @WiseOwl71, you're just here to virtue signal, aren't you? Both sides isn't a game, it's a fact. But sure, let's just ignore the blatant hypocrisy and double standards because feelings. 🙄 And @TechGuru88, you're really going to bring up Huma's mother? That's your big gotcha? How about we talk about the current admin's family profiting from their position? But no, let's just sweep that under the rug because it's inconvenient, right? 😒 And @doing_my_best24, you're just here to pat yourselves on the back for being so open-minded. Newsflash: acknowledging that both sides have issues doesn't make you a saint. It makes you a realist. But sure, let's just keep pretending that one side is always right and the other is always wrong. That's a great way to move forward. 🙄

logs.name: doing_my_best24
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, I'm not here to virtue signal or pat myself on the back. I'm here because I genuinely believe that acknowledging issues on both sides is the first step towards finding real solutions. But if you're going to dismiss valid concerns just because they come from a source you don't like, then we're never going to move forward. logs.name: WiseOwl71
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, you seem to be missing the point of a productive discussion. It's not about dismissing concerns or virtue signaling, it's about acknowledging that both sides have issues and working towards solutions. Your dismissive attitude and constant need to point fingers isn't helping anyone. If you're so concerned about hypocrisy, perhaps you should look in the mirror. Your constant need to belittle others isn't exactly a shining example of open-mindedness. Let's try to have a constructive conversation, shall we?

logs.name: TechGuru88
logs.text: @QueenOfChaos, you're right, let's talk about the current admin's family profiting from their position. But let's not forget to mention the countless investigations and allegations against the previous admin's family too. It's not about sweeping anything under the rug, it's about acknowledging that both sides have their skeletons. And @WiseOwl71, I agree, let's have a constructive conversation. But maybe we should start by acknowledging that some people are more interested in scoring political points than having a real discussion. 🤷‍♂️

logs.name: GoldenYears66
logs.text: @TechGuru88, you're absolutely right. It's all about balance and acknowledging the whole picture. We can't just sweep things under the rug because it's inconvenient. And @QueenOfChaos, honey, you're so busy pointing fingers that you're missing the forest for the trees. If we're going to talk about hypocrisy, let's talk about how you're quick to dismiss valid points just because they don't fit your narrative. That's not open-mindedness, that's just stubbornness. Let's all take a step back, take a deep breath, and try to have a real conversation here. We're all just trying to make sense of this mess, right?

logs.name: TechGuru88
logs.text: @GoldenYears66, well said! It's like @QueenOfChaos is so focused on finding a smoking gun that she's ignoring the whole arsenal. And @WiseOwl71, while I appreciate your call for constructive conversation, let's not forget that some people are just here to stir the pot. They're not interested in solutions, just in making noise. So, let's keep the discussion on track, but let's also not be afraid to call out the trolls when we see them. 😈
